snippet: A Canadian project aimed at creating a genetically engineered pig whose manure would be less harmful to the environment is being halted after failure to find a company willing to bring the animal to market, according to the lead researcher.
abstract: Canadian project aimed at creating a genetically engineered pig whose manure would be less harmful to the environment is being halted after failure to find a company willing to bring the animal to market; so-called enviropig has a gene that allows it to better digest phosphorus in food, leading to less damaging waste; Ontario Pork, an organization of hog farmers supporting the project, has cut funding.
lead_paragraph: A Canadian project aimed at creating a genetically engineered pig whose manure would be less harmful to the environment is being halted after failure to find a company willing to bring the animal to market, according to the lead researcher.

headline.seo: Gene-Altered Pig Project in Canada Is Halted
headline.main: Move to Market Gene-Altered Pigs in Canada Is Halted
headline.print_headline: Move to Market Gene-Altered Pigs in Canada Is Halted
